questions.question: …………….. usually start walking at around one year old.
questions.description: No article is used when we talk about people or things in general.

questions.question: …………… prices have nearly doubled recently.
questions.description: We use no article with plural and uncountable nouns to talk about things in general.

questions.question: Do you like ……………..?
questions.description: No article is used here because we are talking about cats in general.

questions.question: I would like to meet Jumpa Lahiri, ………………
questions.description: After a noun we can use an identifying expression with ‘the’ to give the impression that the person we are talking about is well-known.

questions.question: Do you know ……………….?
questions.description: Here the use of the ‘the’ makes it clear that the speaker knows only one Alderson family.

questions.question: My children love ………………. but I like …………
questions.description: The article ‘the’ is used with a number of expressions referring to our physical environment. Examples are: the sea, the seaside, the hills, the mountains etc.

questions.question: Can I have ……………….. pancake?
questions.description: We usually use ‘the’ with expressions like first, second, next, last etc.

questions.question: Have you ever heard of ……………… Years’ War?
questions.description: There was only one Thirty Years’ War, so we use ‘the’ with it.

questions.question: My brother and his wife live in …………….
questions.description: We do not normally use articles with place names.

questions.question: Let’s go by ………………
questions.description: Articles are not used in some common fixed expressions.

questions.question: I am tired. I think I should go to …………
questions.description: Articles are not used in some common fixed expressions to do with place, time and movement.
